subject: Politics
title: Election Fraud
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Election Fraud.

hook.text: Belarus reported Lukashenko won 80% of the vote. Nobody believed it. Stolen elections steal democracy itself.

buildup.text: Election fraud includes ballot stuffing, voter suppression, manipulation of counts, and banning opposition candidates.

discovery.text: Autocrats rarely cancel elections. They rig them instead. The appearance of democracy provides a veneer of legitimacy.

twist.text: Subtle fraud is more common than obvious rigging. Gerrymandering, voter ID laws, and media control tilt outcomes.

climax.text: Election monitoring by international observers has improved. But sophisticated fraud keeps evolving to stay ahead.

punchline.text: Stolen elections kill democracy from within. Ballots only work when votes count.

quiz.question: Why do autocrats hold elections instead of canceling them?
options: Rigged elections provide a veneer of democratic legitimacy
International law forces all countries to hold elections
